title: Drawing, "Design for four bow knots", 1825–50
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash on white laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Two rows; those above and below at right with a hanging pearl, those at right with a round diamond in the center.  The ribbons intended to be covered with diamonds. A framing graphite line.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for four bow knots", 1825–50.
1825–50. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5384.
